Class UmsatzService

Namespace
IbeAppWeb.Services
Assembly
IbeAppWeb.dll

Provides methods for retrieving revenue data (Umsatz) based on various criteria, such as vehicle, date ranges, and project database context.

public class UmsatzService
Inheritance
object
UmsatzService
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Remarks

This service interacts with an external API to fetch revenue-related data. It supports multiple query scenarios, including filtering by vehicle, date ranges, and project-specific contexts. The service handles HTTP requests and responses, ensuring proper error logging and default fallback values in case of failures.

Constructors

UmsatzService(HttpClient, ILogger<UmsatzService>)

Initializes a new instance of the UmsatzService class.

public UmsatzService(HttpClient httpClient, ILogger<UmsatzService> logger)

Parameters

httpClient HttpClient

The HttpClient instance used to send HTTP requests.

logger ILogger<UmsatzService>

The ILogger<TCategoryName> instance used for logging operations.

Methods

GetProjectsUmsatzSplit(DateTime?, DateTime?, bool, bool)

Retrieves the revenue split for all projects within the specified date range.

public Task<AllProjectsUmsatzSplitDto> GetProjectsUmsatzSplit(DateTime? startDatum, DateTime? endDatum, bool isSchacht, bool dbActive)

Parameters

startDatum DateTime?

The start date of the range for which the revenue split is calculated. If null, no start date filter is applied.

endDatum DateTime?

The end date of the range for which the revenue split is calculated. If null, no end date filter is applied.

isSchacht bool
dbActive bool

Returns

Task<AllProjectsUmsatzSplitDto>

An AllProjectsUmsatzSplitDto object containing the revenue split data for all projects. If an error occurs, an empty AllProjectsUmsatzSplitDto is returned.

Remarks

This method sends an HTTP GET request to the API endpoint to fetch the revenue split data. Ensure that the HTTP client is properly configured and the API endpoint is accessible.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the response content is null.

GetUmsatzByFahrzeugAndDateAsync(DateTime?, int, string)

Retrieves revenue data for a vehicle based on the specified date and context.

public Task<UmsatzResultDto> GetUmsatzByFahrzeugAndDateAsync(DateTime? saniertAm = null, int ComboBoxValue = 1, string projectDb = "defaultDb")

Parameters

saniertAm DateTime?

The date to filter the revenue data. If null, no date filter is applied.

ComboBoxValue int

Determines the context for the query. Use 1 for "kanal" context and any other value for "schacht" context.

projectDb string

The name of the project database to use for the query. Defaults to "defaultDb" if not specified.

Returns

Task<UmsatzResultDto>

An UmsatzResultDto containing the revenue data for the specified vehicle and date. Returns an empty UmsatzResultDto if an error occurs during the operation.

Remarks

This method sends an HTTP request to fetch revenue data for a vehicle. The context of the query is determined by the ComboBoxValue parameter. Ensure that the projectDb parameter matches the name of a valid project database.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the response content is null.

GetUmsatzByFahrzeugAndMonteurAllAsync(DateTime?, DateTime?, int, string)

Retrieves revenue data for vehicles and mechanics within a specified date range and project context.

public Task<UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurProjectResultDto> GetUmsatzByFahrzeugAndMonteurAllAsync(DateTime? start = null, DateTime? end = null, int ComboboxValue = 1, string projectDb = "defaultDb")

Parameters

start DateTime?

The start date of the revenue data range. If null, no start date filter is applied.

end DateTime?

The end date of the revenue data range. If null, no end date filter is applied.

ComboboxValue int

Determines the type of query to execute. A value of 1 retrieves data for "kanal" (channel), while other values retrieve data for "schacht" (shaft).

projectDb string

The name of the project database to query. Defaults to "defaultDb" if not specified.

Returns

Task<UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurProjectResultDto>

A UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurProjectResultDto object containing the revenue data for vehicles and mechanics. Returns an empty result if an error occurs during the API call.

Remarks

This method fetches revenue data based on the provided parameters, including the date range, project database, and a combobox value that determines the type of query. The data is retrieved from an external API and returned as a UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurProjectResultDto object. If no date range is specified, the method retrieves data for all available dates.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the response content from the API is null.

GetUmsatzByFahrzeugMonteurAsync(DateTime?, DateTime?, int, string)

Retrieves revenue data for a vehicle mechanic based on the specified date range, category, and project database.

public Task<UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurResultDto> GetUmsatzByFahrzeugMonteurAsync(DateTime? SaniertAmVon = null, DateTime? SaniertAmBis = null, int ComboBoxValue = 1, string projectDb = "defaultDb")

Parameters

SaniertAmVon DateTime?

The start date of the date range filter. If null, no start date filter is applied.

SaniertAmBis DateTime?

The end date of the date range filter. If null, no end date filter is applied.

ComboBoxValue int

The category selector. Use 1 for "kanal" and any other value for "schacht". Defaults to 1.

projectDb string

The name of the project database to query. Defaults to "defaultDb".

Returns

Task<UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurResultDto>

An UmsatzFahrzeugMonteurResultDto containing the revenue data for the specified filters. If an error occurs or the response content is null, an empty result is returned.

Remarks

This method sends an HTTP request to fetch revenue data for a vehicle mechanic. The data can be filtered by a date range and category, and the target database can be specified. If no date range is provided, the method retrieves all available data. The category is determined by the ComboBoxValue parameter, which selects between "kanal" (value 1) and "schacht" (other values).

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the response content is null after a successful HTTP request.
